revised_title: Inflammatory Tumors Caused by a Large Fly Larva: Two Case Studies
tldr: The author presents two case studies of inflammatory tumors caused by the larva of a large fly (Cestrus humanus) beneath the skin in human subjects. The first case involves a soldier in Surinam, and the second case is a carpenter in Columbia. The author also proposes the name Cestrus humanus for the identified larva.
